Write-Up Text: People are abuzz with the upcoming federal budget in May and concerns about the JobSeeker payment energy transition and national parks are gaining traction. Prominent Australians such as former Treasury Secretary Ken Henry and rugby player David Pocock are calling for increased government support for job seekers. Other people from the Latrobe Valley and Collie in Western Australia are requesting a national energy transition authority be included in the upcoming federal budget. Additionally Labor MPs are joining the chorus of voices demanding JobSeeker payments be increased. Meanwhile funding for National Parks is set to improve with the aim of preventing decay of natural treasures. Finally a tweet encourages conscious communication by pointing out that humiliating others is not necessary to make a point.
